result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Buford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

straight time, no good time. Defendant to report by 10-15-14; failure to report will result in 60 days straight time.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Possess no weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No illegal substances.
No contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Programming. 
Random urine screens.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D Buford in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael D Buford in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 20 days straight time, no good time, in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served. Defendant to report by 10/15/14; failure to report will result in 60 days straight time.
*
AS TO COUNT 6:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 39 MONTHS, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED Count 6 Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 45 days  in the House of Correction, STAYED, until next court date.
-Successfully complete Batterers Intervention Programming.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-No illegal substances.
-Random urine screens.
-No Contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
-Possess no weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Court denied the request for expungement.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Ryan T. Sanson for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1 ,2,4,5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 6:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Conditions of bail to remain.  The 10/06/14 jury trial is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State and defense counsel request a plea and sentencing date.  Case is scheduled for plea and sentencing in Branch 40 on 09/05/2014 at 08:30am.

Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial in Branch 40. Defense would like a new trial date as they have just received a new offer and need time to review it.  Court granted the request. Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court admonished defendant regarding his use of THC and advised him that any further positive tests could result in higher cash bail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court grants State's request for bail condition modification and orders defendant referred to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.     No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz and Heather Johnson.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Klimetz for attorney Johnson.
Arraignment scheduled for 05-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.

Original information received and filed;  arraignment NOT held.  Parties request case be adjourned for arraignment and bail hearing in Branch 40.

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain in effect, including the No Contact Order.

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:   City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Daniel Drewek.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHARDAI M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael D Buford in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.  Defendant Michael D Buford in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
